result.execSummary:
The defendant Lashawn Michelle Poindexter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
To be paid by 5/14/16.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.

Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
No drivers license suspension.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lashawn Michelle Poindexter in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 3 days, Huber privileges for work and child care. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 12 MONTHS.   
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Complete 20 hours of community service
-No drivers license suspension
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 5/14/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 5/14/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Justice Point Report

Defendant Lashawn Michelle Poindexter in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information. Judgment of Conviction entered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm and she may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lashawn Michelle Poindexter in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Brandon Wigley for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lashawn Michelle Poindexter in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Lashawn Michelle Poindexter in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ORIGINAL COMPLAINT NOT IN FILE.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
